name: Glossopharyngeal Neuralgia with Cardiac Syncope
chief_complaint: Severe, stabbing pain in my throat and ear, sometimes makes me pass out
prognosis: Variable - medical management successful in ~70% cases, surgical options for refractory cases
description: A rare neuropathic pain syndrome involving the glossopharyngeal nerve (CN IX) characterized by severe paroxysmal pain in the throat, ear, and tongue. In some cases, pain triggers a vagal response leading to bradycardia and syncope (cardioinhibitory response). Often misdiagnosed as trigeminal neuralgia initially.
